name: The Aurelia Blog - Page 15
description: The official blog of the Aurelia project and Core Team.

posts.name: Aurelia on .NET Rocks
posts.description: If you are a .NET developer...or really any developer interested in hearing some discussion on Aurelia, check out the latest .NET Rocks episode [http://www.dotnetrocks.com/?show=1279].

posts.name: Aurelia Late March Patch Update
posts.description: In the last month we've accomplished a couple of major goals on our way to the official v1 release of Aurelia: updating to Babel 6, removing required external polyfills and dual compatibility with JSPM 16 and 17. This week, we've got a few fixes and some extra goodies.

posts.name: i18n Update Release
posts.description: This week we launched updates of Aurelia libraries built with Babel 6. We had one library that we weren't able to update at that time: aurelia-i18n.

posts.name: Aurelia Babel 6 and JSPM Update
posts.description: Today, we're happy to announce an update to Aurelia that is built with Babel 6 along with updates to our codebase to work with JSPM 0.17 Beta.

posts.name: Preparing for Infrastructure Update
posts.description: Finally...we are almost ready to release an update to Aurelia which moves us onto Babel 6.x. At the same time, we've got fixes and have done testing to enable preliminary support for JSPM 0.17.x soon too.

posts.name: Aurelia <3 Webpack
posts.description: Thanks to the incredible work of community member Martijn Boland [https://github.com/martijnboland] we're happy to announce preliminary support for Webpack!

posts.name: Aurelia Early March 2016 Update
posts.description: Lots of exciting things are happening with Aurelia these days. We've got a new set of updates that bring along many bug fixes as well as a few new features. We've also managed to decrease the minimal size of the library by a significant amount.
